snippet: Thousands of activists rallied outside the Ministry of Defense headquarters in Cairo on Friday, calling for Egyptians to join them in a general strike to mark one year under military rule.
abstract: Thousands of activists rallied outside the Ministry of Defense headquarters in Cairo on Friday, calling for Egyptians to join them in a general strike to mark one year under military rule.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of Egyptian activists marched to the Ministry of Defense headquarters in Cairo on Friday, demanding an end to military rule as the country prepares to mark the first anniversary of President Hosni Mubarak's resignation. The activists rallied outside the building and renewed calls for Egyptians to join them in a general strike, beginning on Saturday and continuing until the military council that has ruled Egypt since Feb. 11, 2011, cedes power to a civilian council.

headline.main: Egyptian Activists Plan to Escalate Protests Against Military Rule

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
